_header: Mine heart hath sent glad hope in his message
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Grenoble, Bibl. municipale, Grenoble 873: no English in this MS, despite Brown and Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown, and Rossell Hope Robbins. The Index of Middle English Verse. New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press, 1943 listing of editions: Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 269; MacCracken (1911)
XMacCracken, Henry Noble. “An English Friend of Charles d’Orleáns.” PMLA 26 (1911): 142-180, 177; Sauerstein (1899)
XSauerstein, Paul. Charles d’Orléans und died englishce übersetzung seiner dichtungen. Halle: Karras, 1899, 65-6.
_description: A roundel by Charles d’Orléans — fourteen lines

BNfr25458.First Lines:
[M]yn hert hath send glad hope in hys messageVn to comfort plesans
                    ioye and sped…
BNfr25458.Last Lines:
…And of whysshynge of tymys shal hym fedGlad hope folyw &
                    sped wele thys viage[M]yn hert &c
